intro: Eriocaulon sparganioides, commonly known as the spike moss, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences. This plant typically grows in wet, acidic environments such as bogs and marshes. It has rhizomes that help anchor it in the soil and facilitate vegetative propagation. Eriocaulon sparganioides plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing microhabitats for various organisms.
